title: Computer-Assisted Language Learning (CALL) Course for Simulation/VR-Based Mathematics Terminology and Concept Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mathematical Knowledge and Comprehension of Job-Related Technical Terminology
context.additional_context: Course for current professionals conducting language learning leveraging mathematical domain expertise in VR/simulation environments

learning_goals: Learners can solve practical problems using mathematical terminology with 90% accuracy in VR simulation environments.
Learners achieve 85% or higher in peer-assessed criteria for explaining mathematical concepts through task-based gamification activities.

In a constructivist collaborative learning environment, learners will work in teams of 3–5 to complete a 6-month language learning project (e.g., math terminology dictionary, scenario-based problem-solving development) using math concepts (fractions, ratios, functions) and achieve ≥80% suitability in peer reviews and expert evaluations.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
